intro: Hoffmannia pallidiflora, commonly known as the pale-flowered hoffmannia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its flowers are small and pale, often with a yellowish or greenish hue, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Hoffmannia pallidiflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
